meanings.definition: A book with a flexible paper cover.
meanings.sent1: I prefer reading a paperback because it is lighter to carry around.
meanings.sent2: She bought a paperback novel to read on her vacation.
meanings.sent3: Why did the paperback bring a pencil to the party? To draw attention!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a paperback, easily opened and read by those around her.
meanings.sent5: The paperback fluttered in the wind like a delicate leaf.

meanings.definition: A book that is bound in a flexible paper cover.
meanings.sent1: The bookstore had a wide selection of paperback books for sale.
meanings.sent2: He always chooses a paperback over a hardcover for its portability.
meanings.sent3: The paperback and the hardcover had a race to see who could finish first.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a paperback, easily torn and mended with each new chapter.
meanings.sent5: The paperback crinkled in her hands as she turned the pages eagerly.

meanings.definition: A book that is typically less expensive than a hardcover book.
meanings.sent1: I decided to buy the paperback version of the book to save money.
meanings.sent2: Paperback editions are more affordable for students on a budget.
meanings.sent3: Why did the hardcover feel jealous of the paperback? It couldn't handle the competition!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a paperback, freely shared and enjoyed by all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The paperback shone brightly on the shelf, beckoning readers with its lower price.
